alert.note: Alert for Le Sueur (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 7:46PM CDT until May 11 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LE SUEUR...NORTHERN BLUE EARTH AND SOUTHEASTERN NICOLLET COUNTIES... At 746 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cleveland, or 14 miles northeast of Mankato, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Le Sueur, northern Blue Earth and southeastern Nicollet Counties, including the following locations... Skyline, Oshawa, Mankato Airport, St Thomas, Lake Jefferson, Ottawa and St Henry. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
